title: Can we add this to Essence Reaver please?
body: Can Essence Reaver please proc the passive with single target spells as well as basic attacks? This would allow it to fulfill the AD Caster niche item better.

replies.body: finally we can have an item that gives mana back the way it should

It just needs a better build path. 

Something that gives either the passive or some mana regen for laning. 

If they did that it would see more play because people would start it for lane and end up finishing. 

The item is actually strong. CDR, 80ad, life steal, mana return. It is not a weak item. But by the time you would build it you'd be close to finishing a muramana for 1k less.

While I agree with it needing a better build path, I'm not concerned too much with it being seen in play or even how stat efficient it is, I'm concerned about it properly filling a much overlooked niche for the AD Casters. Also, I agree the item itself is very strong, but at the moment it only really works well for half of the niche it was made for.

It won't be filling any niche at all until it gets a major build path overhaul.
It just won't be built. This isn't a bad idea at its core, but the problem is that implementing it won't change a thing.
It needs mana sustain earlier, or it's going to be practically irrelevant.

I actually feel as though making essence reaver build out of the brutalizer, a pickaxe, and the vamp sceptre would fit it far better. Keep the same cost, and remove 10 AD but give it 10 armor pen instead. Thoughts?
It could work. But it would cost it more than 10ad to get 10 apen.

No, the only reason it doesn't have play is because the pros don't get it.

The only reason the pros don't get it is because "hur dur mana over time isn't good in teamfights"

The "pros" used to say it was bad because "hur dur only 50 ad and not 80"

And now that it has more ad they still don't get it because crit is so broken. 

Reaver is just waiting for crit to be nerfed. 

I'm a Jinx main that buys reaver every game and my team gets salty 100% faster if I don't get a good lead fast.

Unsure why the Jinx comment. 
Bloodthirster has a 9% higher winrate on her. And her mana isn't really hard to manage. And a squishy unmobile ADC would get farm for out of Bt's shield and higher lifesteal. Not saying it's a weak item on her. But I can't help but dislike people to claim they know everything about a champion because they "main" them. With that being their only proof as to why they're right.

Far as the rest. Most champions that would build it either get more out of Muramana or can easily manage their mana. And most of these champions would want the assistance with mana in lane. Which is again where building Muramana comes in ahead again. 

Problem still stays. The item is easily outclassed by BT or Muramana. Not to mention these AD casters would have to actually AA for the mana return. 

Muramana's build can be put off while tear builds up. ER cannot. 
Muramana regens without combat. ER does not. 
Muramana can easily be bought into lane. ER can if the enemy is feeding you or the laning phase is taking forever. But it's not likely you will ever see this item in lane. Nor should you. AD caster should be building armor pen. ADC's will generally be starting with IE outside of a few of them that build BorTK first.

"Bloodthirster has a 9% higher winrate on her."

That's because more people buy bt. 99% of people that get Reaver are just "trying it out" and not shifting their play style around it. 

I have over 600 games with Jinx in ranked. I'm the only person on this thread that actually BUYS Reaver.

I bought it when it was 50 ad. I bought it when it was 60 ad. And I still buy it now. Building it out of lower tier items won't do anything for "giving it more play" The reason it wasn't used in the first place was because it was only 50 ad and a low tier item. 

I have enough to worry about in team fights other than looking for a mob to hit to get my BT stacks. Reaver is the cheapest 80 ad item. While I'm enjoying my +80 ad the other adc is still waiting for their IE and I'm down in CS.

"With that being their only proof as to why they're right."

I gave you a history of why people don't buy it. With it building out of the same items as BT I can at least get away with building it on Jinx. With your avocation of building it out of Forbidden Idol not only will it remain a niche item, but the one person that actually buys it (me) will stop buying it.

Or more people buy BT over Reaver because it's more effective on her as a champion?  She is an immobile ADC with limited CC. Meaning she's easier to gank than most ADC's. 10% more lifesteal and a shield are far more effective on her than mana that she shouldn't be using up anyway. 

She is not a mana intensive champion.

You gave me the history of why you THINK people don't buy it. Followed by a few paragraphs about the item or why you buy it. 
Thus, your only proof is in your own mind. You cannot back up anything that it's an ideal weapon on her. 

It's not a weak item on her or anything. But BT is generally superior in every situation unless you are horrible at managing your mana. Which by the time you even build the item, you shouldn't have as much to worry about.

I never said anything about Forbidden Idol. I said it needs to build out of something that can be useful in lane if the item wants to see any light of use outside of a few cases of people who just like the item. 

There was an item on the PBE that built out of Vamp Scepter +400g(or maybe 450) that gave a slightly weaker version of the mana leach passive. I believe it was 2-6% instead of 2-8%. With the 10% LS and I think 20 or 25AD. 

For 1200g that would be a fitting item for an early buy. ADCs tend to get Vamp Scepter early even if they don't finish the item. For 400g you could get that passive as well. 

If they added this. Then made Reaver also build out of Bruitalizer, dropping probably 15-20 AD for the 10 pen. It'd see a lot more action on both ADC's and AD casters. 

Until then. It just cannot compare to Muramana. Which will provide strong AD from the passive. Very strong on hit damage. Easier to build it while providing a use in lane. And topped of by being much cheaper.

ive heard rumor of them working on an item that will take the current place of vamp scepter(?) that will help fix the build path. its funny because this item is cheaper than bloodthirster, and IMO its better and people still don't like it. 10% less lifesteal is not horrible because you get mana restore and cdr

currently i would say that essence reaver is what makes yorick viable at least for me it does the lifesteal AND the cdr you get is worth getting this item over muramana (which takes a shitload of time to finish charging btw)
get a trinity force next to it and you ROLL the lanes easy peasy
Rito pls

A build path including an item with a lesser version of it's passive (or just an AD+mana regen item) would go a long way to improving it, 'cause it's build path is kinda harsh for the amount of utility you're buying.

Imagine an item with 10-25 AD somewhere, 5-10% CDR, and 5 flat mana per AA. costs around 1300, same as Brutalizer.

Build path: {{item:1036}} + {{item:1004}} + either flat combine cost, or another of either.

Then you combine this item with Vamp Scepter, and maybe a pickaxe depending on this new item's total cost and AD.

What if they got rid of the vamp scepter and replaced it with brutilizer, reduced the ad of the final item by say, 20,  and added +5 armor pen to the finished item? So it would have the passive, 15 Armor pen, 10% CDR, and 60 AD or something like that, stats are subject to change.

 Right now its issue is that it competes with bloodthirster and Botrk for a lifesteal slot and compared to the other two in that regard, it's less efficient so long as you manage your mana. If it instead competed with flat armor pen items then more people might pick it up at least as a third or fourth item.

To your armor pen suggestion the short answer is no. The long answer is that between Ghostblade, Cleaver, and LW there is already enough pen and tanks wouldn't be able to even compete with armor if we added another armor pen item. I mean did we like the League of Cleavers?

And I agree that it does compete with the lifesteal slot, however, I believe Essence Reaver *should* be the AD Caster sustain item. As in core, as building a Botrk or Thirster complements this item well. 

But it would be interesting to see essence reaver passive on an item that builds from stinger + BF or Pickaxe.

I would prefer this build path for an Essence Reaver kind-of item:
{{item:3134}}  + {{item:1037}}  + {{item:1004}} 
It needs to have AD on it
There are enough good other lifesteal items, so it don't need to have on it.
Armorpen, CDR are good stats for AD casters, hte intended users of this item
and some extra mana regen.

The problem with the current Essence Reaver's unique passive, is that it functions lot less effectively compared to chalice and Manamune. After you unload your tiny mana pool, you don't want to rely on hitting something, enemy minions or champions to gain your mana back. You want to arrive into a team fight with your supplies or just gain it back passively, so it definitely needs a new passive, something early game oriented, which is not too abuseable for top lane champions and still useful on marksmen. It might needs to be a heirloom item, expanding it's unique passive when the owner of it reaches certain levels.

This is how it should be 
{{item:3508}} = {{item:1053}} + {{item:3134}}  + {{item:3114}}  + 463 gold

> [{quoted}](name=Desmond Law,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2015-01-07T00:11:46.805+0000)
>
> This is how it should be 
> {{item:3508}} = {{item:1053}} + {{item:3134}}  + {{item:3114}}  + 463 gold

yeah but AD+LS+Mana regen+Armor Pen+20% CDR is ridiculous. Its such an overly perfect item.
too bad the last item they had to make the item better failed.

The only problem I see with this is the fact that if you cast a spell with a low mana cost (Ezreal's q), you would be regaining mana for using a spell, which is pretty counterintuitive. A big part of playing champs like ez and jayce in the laning phase is careful conservation of mana, and with this new proposal, it seems like mana would hardly be a problem anymore. For example, the only real mana expenditure for ezreal in lane is generally his q. While it may have a low mana cost, enemy laners can take control over this lane by dodging the shot, putting ezreal at a mana disadvantage, negating a strong portion of his power. If this change were in place, ezreal could just rush it as his first item, finishing 1000 gold ahead of anyone trying for an IE or a BT, still get strong stats, and will be able to spam his q to *regain mana*, which just seems overpowered to me.

Ez procs on-hit effects with his q, right?

Isn't the passive on Essence Reaver an on-hit effect? So doesn't he already get mana back for using a spell with Essence Reaver?
this seems irrelevant. It is a special case and in no way justifies buffing this item

But would it really be a buff? Who would it even benefit to proc off single-target spells that isn't an off build? Of the people that could use this item, Corki has all AoE spells, Ez's only single-target already procs on-hit effects, MF's double-up is the same, Sivir has no single-target spells. Would Ashe's Q proc it with the proposed change? Urgot would probably like it.
Yup.

Single target spells ? Give me examples of champions that want that so I'd understand the idea better; you're throwing the idea out there but it's vague because I can't see who would use it.

Pantheon? He's normally better off with a Hydra. Jax? Botrk Trinity too good. I dunno give me examples.

Champions that would want this would be {{champion:80}} [For a sustained laning build], {{champion:6}}, {{champion:76}} [The AD Variant], {{champion:83}}, {{champion:39}}, {{champion:24}} [Alternate core items would be nice], {{champion:17}}, {{champion:53}} [Ad blitz wouldn't mind], {{champion:28}}, and finally {{champion:126}}.

> [{quoted}](name=ZeroQuest96,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=00110001,timestamp=2015-01-07T10:16:38.112+0000)
>
>  and finally {{champion:126}}.

Even the single target thing wouldn't help very much...
Essence Reaver already works on him well because of his cannon form W, and nothing else but his hammer form E is a single target spell.

> [{quoted}](name=ZeroQuest96,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=00110001,timestamp=2015-01-07T10:16:38.112+0000)
>
> Champions that would want this would be {{champion:80}} [For a sustained laning build], {{champion:6}}, {{champion:76}} [The AD Variant], {{champion:83}}, {{champion:39}}, {{champion:24}} [Alternate core items would be nice], {{champion:17}}, {{champion:53}} [Ad blitz wouldn't mind], {{champion:28}}, and finally {{champion:126}}.

I don't know, Irelia doesn't really have mana problems uf you start flask and AD nidalee can just auto attack the minions a lot. Also, Teemo has 0 mana problems.
The examples are weird.. Then again Rito put muramana for these casters, why not give them more power for the YOLO. They're not gonna break the game or anything. +1
uuuuuum{{champion:6}}, {{champion:6}}, {{champion:6}} also {{champion:6}} almost all the time on {{champion:6}} oh and  {{champion:6}} would love it. also maybe {{champion:41}} or{{champion:83}}
GP doesn't have single target spells, his Q is an auto attack. Yorick and Urgot I guess /might/ use it since by the time they have the gold for that, they should be getting tanky unless they're fed.

> [{quoted}](name=YOU BEEN WARNED,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=001100000002,timestamp=2015-01-07T17:09:27.685+0000)
>
> GP doesn't have single target spells, his Q is an auto attack. Yorick and Urgot I guess /might/ use it since by the time they have the gold for that, they should be getting tanky unless they're fed.

If it worked with single target spells it would replace Muramana on him, because his Q wouldn't suck up all of his mana. Plus, free CDR. Urgot would love it.
Urgot OK, that's a good one. Only Jayce's hammer E would benefit from this change, hence why I'm questioning if this is needed.

I actually think there a lot more skills in Jayce's kit that benefit from this.. If the mana regen were to proc on AA, then his gun stance W, his hammer stance Q, and E would benefit from this. Cause technically, his hammer stance Q is a single target ability. and deals attack damage, his gun stance W procs an attack speed buff to his AA, and is a single target ability. As well as hammer stance E

It already procs off AA so it already works on Jayce W. His Q targets 1 person but deals AoE so it won't count with the proposed change.

As I said, with the change the item will restore mana on hammer E only.

Most of the AD casters I can think of don't have any single target spells, so I don't think that change would do much except for ezreal and urgot.  Lucian, Corki, Graves, and Sivir don't have any single target spells.  Jayce would only gain it on his knock-back which I doubt would help him much.

As most have said, the item just needs a better build path and maybe a small buff to the stats.
Lucian is fine, you auto after every spell anyway. I think it's more people like ezreal that would like the buff.
Mostly AD casters would like this. And I honestly think this should be implemented already since this kinda is **THE** AD Caster Sustain item.
You would literally never run out of mana then,especially with on hit effects {{champion:81}}

> [{quoted}](name=TheRikari,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2015-01-07T12:48:25.753+0000)
>
> You would literally never run out of mana then,especially with on hit effects {{champion:81}}

You already never run out of mana with him if you get it right now...
how about it goes back to a pickax and lower the price?

Lower the price yes, goes back to pickaxe no
ER is an early game focused item, so you should be able to run it faster than enemies first main damage items (lower price) and through the process you should never get behind your enemi
Pickaxe put you at a disadvanatage against {{item:1038}}  or {{item:3144}}  (that at least has an active damage and buil in BoTRK), that's why it needed to be removed from ER recipe

The problem remains of how put mana regen into the recipe while reducing the price and not taking away too much stats from ER

Maybe break Essence Reaver down into one or two smaller items that combine close to mid game. So, maybe {{item:1053}}  + {{item:3114}} for the core part and add {{item:1038}} for when you wish to upgrade it into a more mid-late oriented item.

You can't think to survive laning phase on bot lane by running {{item:1053}}  + {{item:3114}}  first, and {{item:1038}}  later. You would be crunched alive by someone who straight up rush BF/Cutlass/Sheen

The true problem is that I don't think Riot wants to add some kind of active damage to ER, because CDR% + mana regen are yet supposed to be damage boost for AD casters, and to be honest I kinda agree with that kind of setting

If you would find safe to add active damage, maybe the solution could be:

{{item:3508}}  (3000 gold)

+60 AD
+10% LS
+10% CDR 

Unique Passive: Your basic attacks restore mana equal to between 2% and 8% of the physical damage dealt, based on your missing mana.

Unique Active: On next autoattack, Deals 150 (+ 1 x every unit of mana restored by the autoattack) physical damage and slows the target enemy champion's movement speed by 25% for 2 seconds. 60 second cooldown. 

Bilgewater Cutlass + Forbidden Idol + Pickaxe + 125G

But to be honest, there is a lot of AD, armor and health itemization choices that needs adjustements, so the problem should be tackled from a bigger perspective, and there you could add some good items for Er building path
I agree with most of your sentiments I was mostly just throwing out some ideas. Also, I don't think Essence Reaver should be looked at as an ADC item but rather a AD Caster item.

Yeah, but how many AD casters that aren't marksmen are there out there? Ez, Sivir and Urgot are the first that comes to mind when thinking to ER, and even half of Jayce kit and the main Gangplank damage tool are marksmen like tools

AD caster often coincide with some kind of marksmen or marksmen ability, so when looking at ER we should look at it ALSO as an ADC item

Actually most AD Casters are top laners and junglers, which Is why I think Essence Reaver should be balanced for them first and then tweeked to be fitting for both. It's much easier to tweek an item after it is somewhat viable in one catagory rather than its current state. I'm not saying we shouldn't consider ADCs I'm just saying only a minority of them would use it. (Mostly ad caster minorities >.>)

> [{quoted}](name=ZeroQuest96,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i6OJwiXN,comment-id=000f000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-07T14:36:09.624+0000)
> I don't think Essence Reaver should be looked at as an ADC item
> I'm not saying we shouldn't consider ADCs

You do know this is text and not speech right? 
I'm sure contradicting yourself two minutes later irl works great but I can SEE what you've wrote seconds later.

Reaver is in a good spot right now. I buy it every game and I main Jinx.

Reaver will never be meta because the pros build full damage. (they don't like the mana stat they just don't like seeing it) 

The pros don't want to take risks with new builds/play styles because they want to keep their jobs.  

Also whoever is down voting Ale is a moron.
